perturbation.original_text:
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. NEITHER PARTY SHALL HAVE ANY LIABILITY HEREUNDER FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFIT OR BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, WHETHER OR NOT THE PARTY WAS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH.

         EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH HEREIN, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY, AND EACH PARTY HEREBY SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THE SERVICES CONTEMPLATED BY THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING ANY



IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND IMPLIED WARRANTIES AFJSING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR COURSE OF PERFORMANCE.
perturbation.changed_text:
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. NEITHER PARTY SHALL HAVE ANY LIABILITY HEREUNDER FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFIT OR BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, WHETHER OR NOT THE PARTY WAS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH.

         EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH HEREIN, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY, AND EACH PARTY HEREBY SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THE SERVICES CONTEMPLATED BY THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND IMPLIED WARRANTIES AFJSING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR COURSE OF PERFORMANCE,' the contract attempts to disclaim implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. Under New York law (since the agreement is governed by New York law as per Section 13.H), these implied warranties cannot be disclaimed without explicitly mentioning 'merchantability' and ensuring the disclaimer is conspicuous. Removing that explicit mention and the course of dealing/performance waiver makes the disclaimer potentially unenforceable and violates consumer protection principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Uniform Commercial Code ยง 2-316 (Disclaimer or Modification of Warranties)

perturbation.original_text: Governing Law. Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without regard to the conflicts of laws principles thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of Detroit, Michigan, without regard to the conflicts of laws principles thereof.
perturbation.explanation: Switching the governing law to Detroit, Michigan (where FMM has offices) potentially undermines consumer protection laws applicable to online services in New York, where iVillage is located and likely where its users are based. Michigan's consumer protection laws may differ significantly from New York's, particularly concerning online advertising and data privacy. This shift could limit iVillage's liability and reduce protections for consumers who are primarily based in New York, violating principles of consumer protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies based on specific consumer rights at stake, could include New York General Business Law relating to deceptive practices or data privacy.
